00050 #ifndef PLATFORM_LINUX
00051 // enable FEC code
00052 //#define RADIO_USE_FEC 1
00053 // send three size bytes instead of one, compute packet size from majority bits
00054 //#define RADIO_REDUNDANT_SIZE
00055 // Send 2 CRC bytes after the data that will be checked after FEC is done
00056 //#define RADIO_EXTRA_CRC
00057 #endif

00059 #ifdef RADIO_USE_FEC
00060 //#define FEC_SIZE_PARITY_COUNT 2
00061 #define FEC_DATA_PARITY_COUNT 8
00062 #endif
00063 
00064 #ifndef RADIO_EXTRA_CRC
00065 #define COM_DATA_SIZE 64 /* Size of com buffer. */
00066 #else
00067 // Add two more bytes to include a CRC that is checked AFTER error-correction
00068 // FIXME this is an ugly way to do this, since some protocols may use
00069 // this number to determine their payload sizes
00070 #define COM_DATA_SIZE 66
00071 #endif
00072 
00073 #ifdef PLATFORM_LINUX
00074 #define NUM_BUFS 255 /* Size of buffer pool. */
00075 
00076 #else
00077 #define NUM_BUFS 5
00078 #endif

00091 typedef struct comBuf_t {
00093    struct comBuf_t *next;
00095    //ANS hack:
00096 #ifdef GET_RSSI
00097    uint16_t signal;
00098 #endif
00099 #ifdef TS_PACKET
00100    uint32_t ts;
00101    uint8_t tcnt;
00102 #endif
00103    //ANS hack ends
00105    uint8_t size;
00107    uint8_t data[COM_DATA_SIZE];
00108 } comBuf;
00109 
00110 #define IFACE_SERIAL   0 // serial port
00111 #define IFACE_SERIAL2  1
00112 #define IFACE_RADIO    2 // RF transceiver, simulated in xmos
00113 #define IFACE_LOOPBACK 3
00114 #ifdef PLATFORM_LINUX
00115 #define IFACE_UDP      4 // udp/ip sockets
00116 #define IFACE_TCP      5 // tcp/ip sockets
00117 #define IFACE_TERMINAL 6 // terminal (input reading)
00118 #endif
00119 #define MAX_IFS        7 // max num of interfaces
00120 
00121 #ifdef PLATFORM_TELOSB
00122 #define com_send_IFACE_STDIO com_send_IFACE_SERIAL2
00123 #define com_ioctl_IFACE_STDIO com_ioctl_IFACE_SERIAL2
00124 #define com_mode_IFACE_STDIO com_mode_IFACE_SERIAL2
00125 #else
00126 #define com_send_IFACE_STDIO com_send_IFACE_SERIAL
00127 #define com_ioctl_IFACE_STDIO com_ioctl_IFACE_SERIAL
00128 #define com_mode_IFACE_STDIO com_mode_IFACE_SERIAL
00129 #endif

00159 /* The possible mode settings for interface devices. */
00160 
00161 enum {
00162    IF_OFF = 0,    // Device can be powered down
00163    IF_STANDBY,    // Device in low power mode w/ wakeup
00164    IF_IDLE,       // Device is on but not receiving
00165    IF_LISTEN,     // Device is on and receiving
00166 #ifdef RADIO_USE_FEC
00167    IF_FEC_ENABLE, // Device is using FEC
00168    IF_FEC_DISABLE // Device is not using FEC
00169 #endif
00170 };

00172 #define PREAMBLE            0x53
00173 #define PREAMBLE_SIZE       2

00177 #define IFACE_NOT_REGISTERED 160

00179 /* different types of com_selects */
00180 #define COM_BLOCK -1
00181 #define COM_NOBLOCK 0
00182 
00183 typedef uint8_t IF_SET;
00184 
00185 /* NOTE: These implementations limit the number of devices to 8. */
00186 #define IF_SET(iface, set) (*set |= 1 << iface) // TODO: check shift direction 
00187 #define IF_CLEAR(iface, set) (*set &= ~(1 << iface)) 
00188 #define IF_ZERO(set) (*set = 0)
00189 #define IF_ISSET(iface, set) (*set & (1 << iface))
